message_1: Calculate the first cohomology group of a circle $S^1$ with coefficients in integers $\mathbb{Z}$.
message_2:
To compute the first cohomology group of a circle $S^1$ with coefficients in integers $\mathbb{Z}$, we will use the Mayer-Vietoris sequence. 

First, we cover the circle $S^1$ with two open sets $U$ and $V$ such that $U \cap V \neq \emptyset$. We can take $U$ and $V$ to be two open arcs that together cover the entire circle, with a small overlap. Then, we have the following Mayer-Vietoris sequence for reduced homology:

$$\cdots \rightarrow \tilde{H}_n(U \cap V) \rightarrow \tilde{H}_n(U) \oplus \tilde{H}_n(V) \rightarrow \tilde{H}_n(S^1) \rightarrow \tilde{H}_{n-1}(U \cap V) \rightarrow \cdots$$

Since we are interested in the first cohomology group, we will focus on the part of the sequence involving $n = 1$:

$$\tilde{H}_1(U \cap V) \rightarrow \tilde{H}_1(U) \oplus \tilde{H}_1(V) \rightarrow \tilde{H}_1(S^1) \rightarrow \tilde{H}_0(U \cap V)$$

Now, we compute the reduced homology groups for $U$, $V$, and $U \cap V$. Since $U$, $V$, and $U \cap V$ are all contractible to a point, their reduced homology groups are trivial for $n \geq 1$:

$$\tilde{H}_1(U) = \tilde{H}_1(V) = \tilde{H}_1(U \cap V) = 0$$

For $n = 0$, we have:

$$\tilde{H}_0(U) = \tilde{H}_0(V) = 0$$
$$\tilde{H}_0(U \cap V) = \mathbb{Z}$$

Now, we can rewrite the relevant part of the Mayer-Vietoris sequence as:

$$0 \rightarrow 0 \oplus 0 \rightarrow \tilde{H}_1(S^1) \rightarrow \mathbb{Z}$$

This simplifies to:

$$0 \rightarrow \tilde{H}_1(S^1) \rightarrow \mathbb{Z}$$

Since the map from $0$ to $\tilde{H}_1(S^1)$ is the zero map, we have that $\tilde{H}_1(S^1)$ is isomorphic to its image in $\mathbb{Z}$, which is the entire group $\mathbb{Z}$. Therefore, we have:

$$\tilde{H}_1(S^1) \cong \mathbb{Z}$$

So, the first cohomology group of a circle $S^1$ with coefficients in integers $\mathbb{Z}$ is $\mathbb{Z}$.
